conclusion: Identify the flow paths of the liquids from A, B, and C.
Liquid from A will flow downwards.
Liquid from B will flow downwards.
Liquid from C will flow downwards.
Observe the arrangement of the baffles and their colors.
The baffles are arranged in a row at the bottom of the image.
The colors of the baffles from left to right are: cyan, gray, gray, green, yellow.
Determine which baffle each liquid will encounter first.
Liquid from A will encounter the cyan baffle first.
Liquid from B will encounter the gray baffle first.
Liquid from C will encounter the gray baffle first.
Predict the flow of the liquids after passing through the baffles.
Liquid from A will flow into container D after passing through the cyan baffle.
Liquid from B will flow into container E after passing through the gray baffle.
Liquid from C will flow into container E after passing through the gray baffle.
Final Answer: Liquid from A will flow into container D, and liquids from B and C will flow into container E.
